title: How is Personal Bias and Prejudice different? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not so much that they are different, but there are two forms of prejudice, one being personal bias, along with institutional prejudice. Personal prejudices are your own feelings towards other’s, whether these are conscious or subconscious, and regardless of what it is about; race, clothes, perceived class and gender etc. Institutional prejudices are the culmination of policies and the personal prejudices of organisations or any social structure, that causes the advantage of one group of people over another. To answer your question, personal bias is one of the key ingredients in prejudice, you can start defeating your own prejudice’s by confronting first your personal bias’.

prej·u·dice A preconceived opinion that is not based on reason or actual experience. bi·as Prejudice in favor of or against one thing, person, or group compared with another, usually in a way considered to be unfair.
